meanings.definition: To make (bacteria) more susceptible to phagocytosis by coating them with opsonins.
meanings.sent1: The scientist opsonised the bacteria to help the immune system fight them off.
meanings.sent2: The doctor opsonised the pathogens to assist the body in clearing the infection.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria felt like they were being opsonised for a fancy dinner party inside the body.
meanings.sent4: The opsonised bacteria were like sitting ducks for the immune cells to attack.
meanings.sent5: The process of opsonising the harmful microbes made them easier targets for the immune system.

meanings.sent1: The opsonised pathogens were quickly recognized by the immune cells.
meanings.sent2: The opsonised bacteria were swiftly engulfed by the white blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The opsonised microbes seemed to be wearing tiny opsonin jackets.
meanings.sent4: The opsonised surface of the bacteria acted like a beacon for the immune system.
meanings.sent5: The opsonised layer on the pathogens made them stand out to the body's defenses.
